source_file: data/05.audio-features/r2batch/The P Word -- How to ＂Show Intent＂ the Right Way [A1Mwr1pDusQ]/The P Word -- How to ＂Show Intent＂ the Right Way [A1Mwr1pDusQ].audio.asr.clean16k.audio_features.json

video_type.reasoning: Single speaker delivering educational content about 'premise' vs 'intent' directly to camera. No live approaches, no back-and-forth dialogue. Uses 'you guys', abstract examples, and clean instructional structure throughout.

SPEAKER_00.reasoning: Delivers entire educational monologue, references coaching students, explains game concepts, promotes his program 'System' at the end.

SPEAKER_01.reasoning: Single 1.2s segment that continues SPEAKER_00's hypothetical scenario ('not a high value guy') - likely a diarization artifact or the coach voicing the girl's perspective.

UNKNOWN.reasoning: Generic 'Thank you for watching' outro after long silence gap. Likely end card or automated outro.

And I think part of the reason it caused quite a stir is it resonated with a lot of people.
A lot of people saw what I was saying, but the problem is I didn't really give you the alternative.
I didn't really tell you what you're replacing intent with.
That's what I'm doing in this video.
It's a new concept I call premise, and it features prominently in the system.
So let's talk about that right now.
so I'm gonna I couch this by saying I'm gonna teach you guys the most important thing in all

at all of game is I recently started doing online coaching lots and lots of online coaching with

know that it's a man to woman interaction, not a friend to
friend interaction or stranger to stranger interaction.

the interaction, the reason why the conversation is taking place.

Every single conversation you ever have has a premise.

there is a premise.

but the default premise is often stranger to stranger.
